alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 9:35AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms moving north into San Diego County will bring periods of locally heavy rainfall to the valleys and mountains. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Temecula, El Cajon, Vista, San Clemente, La Mesa, Poway, Ramona and Alpine. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
